name: SABITHA K N
my_business: Health Insurance consultant.
top_product: Diabetes, Cardiac, Cancer care, Group health insurance for corporate companies.
ideal_referral: Hospitals, Labs, Pharmacist and person who seeks insurance
top_problem_solved: "Successfully resolved challenging insurance claims involving complex or indirect diagnoses by coordinating with doctors, hospitals, and clients to establish medical clarity and ensure fair claim settlements." "Expert in analyzing medical documentation and bridging gaps when diagnosis reasons were not directly stated, resulting in faster and accurate claim approvals."
my_favourite_bni_story: “One of my fellow BNI members had her family health insurance with us. At the time of renewal, I suggested her to upgrade her plan to get a higher coverage and better benefits. She trusted my advice and went ahead with the upgrade. Just a few months later, she was unfortunately diagnosed with cancer. The treatments and hospitalization costs were very high, but because of the upgraded plan, she was able to claim her expenses without financial stress. She later told me, ‘If I hadn’t upgraded the plan, it would have been very difficult for my family.’ This story reminds me why I do what I do — I don’t just sell insurance, I help families stay financially safe during life’s toughest moments. The best referral for me is anyone who wants the right health insurance advice and protection for their family.”

my_favourite_bni_story: The Painter and the Printer A small-town painter joined BNI. In the first few months, he hardly got any direct business and started to wonder if he had made the right decision. But instead of quitting, he chose to focus on giving referrals. He noticed one member owned a printing press. Whenever his clients needed business cards, brochures, or banners, he referred them to the printer. He didn’t expect anything in return. Within a year, the painter had given more than 15 referrals to that printer. One day, the printer got a large contract to rebrand a chain of retail stores. And guess who he called for all the painting work across those stores? The painter. That single contract was worth more than all his membership fees combined, and it came because he had built trust by giving first.
